results.definition: remove oneself from a familiar environment, usually for pleasure or diversion
examples: We escaped to our summer house for a few days

results.definition: a valve in a container in which pressure can build up (as a steam boiler); it opens automatically when the pressure reaches a dangerous level
be incomprehensible to; escape understanding by
nonperformance of something distasteful (as by deceit or trickery) that you are supposed to do
examples: that escape from the consequences is possible but unattractive

results.definition: the discharge of a fluid from some container
examples: they tried to stop the escape of gas from the damaged pipe

results.definition: flee; take to one's heels; cut and run
examples: The burglars escaped before the police showed up
The convicted murderer escaped from a high security prison

results.definition: an inclination to retreat from unpleasant realities through diversion or fantasy
examples: romantic novels were her escape from the stress of daily life
he made his escape from the mental hospital
the canary escaped from its cage

results.definition: escape potentially unpleasant consequences; get away with a forbidden action
a means or way of escaping
examples: hard work was his escape from worry
they installed a second hatch as an escape

results.definition: an avoidance of danger or difficulty
a plant originally cultivated but now growing wild
issue or leak, as from a small opening
